sentences.en: He is really good at playing tambourine.
Hey! Mr. Tambourine Man, play a song for me.
sentences.cn: 嘿! 鼓手坦布尔曼先生,请为我演唱一曲.

sentences.en: I enjoy the beat from the tambourine.
Joseph played the drums, and sometimes the tambourine, in a band called Fields of Grass.
sentences.cn: 约瑟夫在一个名叫“草地”的乐队敲鼓，有的时候敲手鼓。

sentences.en: Let them praise his name with dancing and make music to him with tambourine and harp.
sentences.cn: 愿他们6跳舞赞美他的名,击7鼓弹琴歌颂他.

sentences.en: Participants have to bring their own hand drum, any type of frame drum or tambourine.
sentences.cn: 参加者需要自备手鼓, 任何一种框鼓或铃鼓.

sentences.en: She stood biting her lip, watching, for nearly an hour, until Joseph put his tambourine down and opened his eyes.
sentences.cn: 她咬着嘴唇站在那里，等着，等了将近一个小时，约瑟夫才放下手鼓、睁开眼睛。

sentences.en: Tambourine is an instrument consisting of a small drumhead with jingling disks.
sentences.cn: 小手鼓是一种由边缘嵌有能叮当作响的小金属片的小鼓面.

sentences.en: Tambourine is shaking but I don't hear a song.
sentences.cn: 铃鼓摇动着,我却听不到那首歌.
那个铃鼓看起来挺好玩的.

sentences.en: The maenad on the right is playing a tambourine.
sentences.cn: 而神像右边的女祭司正演奏著小手鼓.

trans.tran_cn: 铃鼓，手鼓，（鸣声似铃鼓的）白胸森鸠
trans.tran_en: a circular musical instrument consisting of a frame covered with skin or plastic and small pieces of metal that hang around the edge. You shake it or hit it with your hand.
